page.title: 10Stafford Common (History).
page.content: The Commoners rights were taken away under an inclosure Act of 1800 and the award of 1807 alloted the householders instead,land in Foregate and Marston Fields.Management of what came to be called Stafford Common was vested in an annual meeting of householders with property worth 5.00 pounds,and rules were adopted at a meeting in 1803. By 1834 cattle were grazed from May until Christmas on the main part of the Common and for the rest of the year on Stone Flat.Each householder could graze two cows or one horse and each burgess,three cows or one cow and one horse.A maintenance fund was raised by charging 4s or 5s a year for each cow and 9s or 10s for each horse and by a levy for carriages and stalls on strangers coming to the races which were held on to Common from 1820.By 1851 over 200 cows and 80 horses were
